intro: Tithymalus ierensis, commonly known as the Ierense tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often emitting a subtle, spicy scent. Tithymalus ierensis is typically found in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in cooler, temperate climates.
